info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Slow moving and training thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Anson, southwestern Montgomery, northwestern Richmond and southeastern Stanly Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Ansonville, or 10 miles south of Albemarle, moving east at 10 mph. These storms have produced up to an inch of rainfall already. HAZARD...Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Ansonville, Norwood, Oakboro, Mount Gilead, Uwharrie Haven, Lake Tillery and Morrow Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
